content:
You're really getting the hang of using Day One to organize and enhance your journal entries!

Now, let's dive into using the photo and audio features to make your entries even more engaging and memorable:

**Adding Photos:**

1. Open the Day One app and navigate to the entry you want to add a photo to.
2. Tap the camera icon in the top-right corner of the entry to access the photo library.
3. Select the photo(s) you want to add from your camera roll or take a new photo.
4. Tap "Add" to add the selected photo(s) to your entry.
5. You can add multiple photos to an entry, and they will be displayed in a gallery view.
6. Tap a photo to view it full-screen, and use the editing tools to crop, rotate, or adjust the brightness/contrast.

**Adding Audio Recordings:**

1. Open the Day One app and navigate to the entry you want to add an audio recording to.
2. Tap the microphone icon in the top-right corner of the entry to start recording.
3. Record your audio note, and tap "Stop" when you're finished.
4. You can add multiple audio recordings to an entry, and they will be displayed below the text editor.
5. Tap an audio recording to play it back, and use the editing tools to trim or delete the recording.

Tips:

* You can add photos and audio recordings to an entry at any time, even after it's been saved.
* Use the "Media" tab on the bottom navigation bar to view all your photo and audio entries.
* Day One also supports video recordings, which can be added using the camera icon.
* You can use the audio feature to record voice notes, interviews, or even create an audio journal.

Now that you know how to add photos and audio recordings, you can start enhancing your Disney World trip entry with visual and audio memories!

Imagine being able to relive the moment when you rode the Seven Dwarfs Mine Train rollercoaster, or listening to your own voice describing the experience. These features will help you create a more immersive and engaging journal entry that will transport you back to the magic of Disney World.

What's next? Would you like to explore more features, such as exporting your entries or using the Day One web app?
